item.title: New York Videogame Critics Announce New York Game Awards Nominees; Astro Bot Gets Four Nominations
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/new-york-videogame-critics-announce-new-york-game-awards-nominees-astro-bot-gets-four-nominations/

The next game award show is coming up, and the New York Videogame Critics Circle has announced the nominees for the upcoming New York Game Awards. There are a variety of awards being given out across a multitude of categories, but you'll find that there are some games that are nominated in multiple categories. Additionally, this event will be honoring Sam Lake, who is a legendary Creative Director over at Remedy Entertainment, where Sam Lake has received the 2025 Andrew Yoon Legend Award.

"2024 was another standout year for video games, and we're thrilled to recognize these stunning projects at the 14th New York Game Awards on January 21. Our team of journalists, interns, and volunteers at NYVGCC look forward to hosting and honoring the many talented individuals who work in the video game industry," says Harold Goldberg, President and Founder of NYVGCC.

Below are all the nominees for the 14th Annual New York Game Awards.

Big Apple Award for Best Game of the Year

  • Balatro
  • Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth
  • Astro Bot
  • UFO 50
  • 1000xResist
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • EA Sports College Football 25

Off Broadway Award for Best Indie Game

  • Tales of Kenzera: ZAU
  • Lorelei and the Laser Eyes
  • Balatro 
  • I Am Your Beast
  • UFO 50
  • 1000xResist
  • Thank Goodness You're Here!
  • Neva

Herman Melville Award for Best Writing in a Game

  • Harold Halibut
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • 1000xResist
  • Life is Strange: Double Exposure
  • Phoenix Springs
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

Statue of Liberty Award for Best World

  • Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
  • Tales of Kenzera: ZAU
  • Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess
  • Astro Bot
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • S.T.A.L.K.E.R 2 Heart of Chornobyl

Tin Pan Alley Award for Best Music in a Game

  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess
  • Life is Strange: Double Exposure
  • Astro Bot
  • Arco
  • Black Myth Wukong
  • 1000xResist

Great White Way Award for Best Acting in a Game

  • Abubakar Salim as Zao, Zuberi and Griot Echo in Tales of Kenzara: ZAO
  • John Eric Bentley as Barret in Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth
  • Hannah Telle as Max Caulfield in Life is Strange: Double Exposure
  • Melina Juergens as Senua in Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Troy Baker as Indiana Jones in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Humberly González as Kay in Star Wars Outlaws

Coney Island Dreamland Award for Best AR/VR Game

  • Thrasher
  • Batman: Arkham Shadow
  • Umurangi Generation VR
  • Skydance's Behemoth
  • Silent Slayer: Vault of the Vampire
  • Shattered

Central Park Children's Zoo Award for Best Kids Game

  • Astro Bot
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
  • Little Kitty, Big City
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations
  • The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

A-Train Award for Best Mobile Game

  • Rabbids: Legends of the Multiverse
  • Wuthering Waves
  • Zenless Zone Zero
  • Ex Astris
  • Pokémon Trading Card Game Pocket

Freedom Tower Award for Best Remake

  • Soul Reaver 1 and 2 Remastered
  • Silent Hill 2
  • Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door
  • Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth
  • Age of Mythology: Retold
  • Persona 3: Reload

Chumley's Speakeasy Award for Best Hidden Gem

  • Ultros
  • Vampire Therapist
  • Mouthwashing
  • Llamasoft: The Jeff Minter Story
  • Mars After Midnight
  • Starstruck: Hands of Time

NYC GWB Award for Best DLC

  • Alan Wake II: Night Springs and The Lake House
  • Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown - Mask of Darkness
  • Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
  • Remnant 2: The Dark Horizon
  • Splatoon 3: Side Order
  • Diablo IV: Vessel of Hatred

Knickerbocker Award for Best Games Journalism

  • Duncan Fyfe
  • Alexis Ong
  • Grant Stoner
  • Mason Andrew Hamberlin
  • Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
  • Simone De Rochefort & Clayton Ashley

That is the full list of nominees for the upcoming New York Game Awards. If you find yourself in the area, you are able to purchase tickets to attend the event in person.

Who do you want to win?

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 1 Begins January 10, Adds Fantastic Four to Roster
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/marvel-rivals-season-1-begins-january-10-adds-fantastic-four-to-roster/

Today, Marvel Games and NetEase Games officially announced the details for the first season of Marvel Rivals. The season is titled Eternal Night Falls and will be adding some familiar faces to the ever-expanding roster of heroes and villains from the Marvel universe. The first season for this new Hero-Shooter will begin on January 10 at 9 AM UTC, where the Fantastic Four will be introduced to the game as playable heroes. Thus far, the title has been incredibly successful.

The season will span over three months and will be divided into two halves. In the first half of the season, Invisible Woman and Mister Fantastic will be released. For those wanting Human Torch and The Thing, you'll have to wait until the second half of the season. Season 1 of Marvel Rivals is doing more than just adding superheroes to the game, as there will be three new maps for players to explore and learn when playing.

If you want to know more about Marvel Rivals Season 1: Eternal Night Falls, make sure to check out the trailer below to get a glimpse of some of the action you will be diving into, as well as the cosmetics you can get your mitts on.

In addition to new heroes and maps, there will be some special events for players to dive into, including a new Doom Match game mode. Like many free-to-play titles with live service elements, there will be a Battle Pass for players to dive into. Compared to Season 0, this Battle Pass has over double the amount of content and rewards to get. These rewards consist of 10 costumes, sprays, and emotes to get your hands on to add some extra flair for the battleground. To purchase the Season 1 Luxury Battle Pass for Marvel Rivals, it will cost you 990 Lattice, where you will then get 600 Lattices and 600 Units as a reward for completing the Season 1 Battle Pass.

Compared to other games on the market right now, the team developing this title has made it so that the Luxury Battle Passes will never expire, with Tokens purchased with Lattice being retained under specific conditions. For those interested in what these terms and conditions consist of, the developers have created both a Dev Diary and a Dev Vision, where you can read about it or watch a video that explains it.

item.title: Former Annapurna Staff Form New Company To Inherit Private Division Franchises
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/former-annapurna-staff-form-new-company-to-inherit-private-division-franchises/

A new company comprised of members from Annapurna is set to take over games and franchises that were previously owned by Private Division, a studio owned by Take-Two Interactive. The staff that are creating the team are those who resigned last summer after it was said that there was a significant power struggle that led to the staff resigning. Now, they are taking over the portfolio that belonged to Private Division.

At the moment, the company that will be inheriting the Private Division franchises doesn't yet have a name, but it will gain access to the games and franchises created by Private Division.

The first information came from Take-Two Interactive in November 2024, where they announced that they had sold Private Division to an unnamed buyer for an undisclosed price. In the report from Bloomberg, it seems that private equity firm Haveli Investments was the "unnamed buyer" of the company, with Haveli then going on to make a deal with the Annapurna staff, which gave them the power to take care of the acquired franchises.  According to the Bloomberg report, a spokesperson for Haveli was contacted, but they stated that "the firm did not immediately have comment."

Private Division was responsible for creating franchises and games such as Kerbal Space Program, Tales of the Shire, No Rest for the Wicked, and the untitled action-adventure game made in collaboration with Game Freak, which is currently codenamed Project Bloom. No Rest for the Wicked has been confirmed to continue getting support and updates, despite the uncertainty of Private Division at current. Tales of the Shire is the next game to be released, with it set to release on March 25. This game is highly anticipated by many, as it combines the farming game genre with The Lord of the Rings franchise for a cozy experience.

As Haveli acquired the company, they also inherited approximately 20 employees who were working at Private Division. Unfortunately, some of the staff that they've inherited will be laid off as the company gets settled and rearranged. The specifics of this arrangement have not been finalized, and staff have been told to explore their options regarding employment and instability in the company.

Private Division was founded in 2017 as a publisher of mid-sized indie titles. They've published games such as The Outer Worlds, Hades, and Rollerdrome.
